body.name: Ricochet: A Novel (Garrett Kohl, Book 3)
body.description: DEA Special Agent Garrett Kohl and his CIA team embark on an off-the-books investigation and partner up with a ragtag crew of outcasts and outlaws to stop extortionists and dismantle their operation before complete devastation rains down in their Texas High Plains community in this pulse-pounding thriller for fans of C. J. Box.After hunting down a rogue spy as part of an elite CIA counterespionage unit, Garrett Kohl returns home to Texas in hopes of settling down and carving out a normal life. While learning the ropes of fatherhood, falling deeper in love with his high school crush, and rebuilding his wildfire ravaged cattle ranch, he is approached in secret by an engineer working at a nearby nuclear weapons plant, who is in desperate need of his help.Utilizing a unique skill set—abilities Garrett has honed as a deep cover narcotics agent and former Green Beret—he embarks on an off-the-books investigation and learns that Iranian operatives are blackmailing weapons facility employees and potentially planning a devastating act of sabotage and destruction.Already engaged in an intense shadow war with Tehran and their Quds Force spies, Garrett’s CIA team rallies to take down the extortionists and dismantle their operation. But before they can get their mission under way, enemy commandos hijack a train carrying nuclear weapons, and activate a lone wolf assassin to murder the visiting U.S. Secretary of Defense.Caught flatfooted by the sudden attack, Garrett musters the only help he can find—a ragtag crew of outcasts and outlaws, some of whom he’d once put behind bars. Although they’re from different walks of life, and opposite sides of the law, they hold in common the deep desire to protect their homes, their families, and their way of life on the remote, wild, and alluring Texas High Plains. From a former CIA intelligence officer and consultant for the Department of Defense comes an exhilarating thriller that shows the power in unity. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast paced high plains action
reviews.reviewText: This tale combined Special ops Iran nuclear weapons old grudges into a story about traitors and stolen nuclear weapons set on th high plains

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars ...great addition to a splendid series. I really enjoyed this book!
reviews.reviewText: Book Review – Ricochet – Taylor MooreAuthor Taylor Moore’s Book 3 of the Garrett Kohl series, “Ricochet,” is a refreshing modern-day western that I thoroughly enjoyed! It was a high-octane, adrenaline-fueled, action-laden thriller that I couldn’t put down. Main character DEA Special Agent Garrett Kohl and his CIA black ops team embark on an off-the-books investigation with a group of outsiders to help Kohl and his team stop a group of Middle-Eastern bad guys from destroying Kohl’s Texas High Plains community. Returning home to Texas in hopes of settling down and carving out a normal life and rebuilding his devastated cattle ranch, Kohl – a former US Army Green Beret - learns that some Iranians are blackmailing employees at a nearby nuclear weapons plant and were planning a devastating act of sabotage and destruction. Kohl rallies his CIA paramilitary team and a miscellaneous crew of outcasts – some of whom he once put behind bars – to take down the blackmailing extortionists and dismantle their devious operation. Intense, Powerful, and Energetic, Ricochet covers all the bases of a well-written, well-plotted, well-told action thriller. It’s a C.J. Fox-like story that kept me on the edge of my seat. I highly recommend reading Taylor’s two other Garrett Kohl books in the series - “Down Range” and “Firestorm,” but know that Ricochet – Book 3 – can standalone. Great addition to a splendid series. I really enjoyed this story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Enjoyed the characters and storyline. I am slow and it too me a bit to tie the loose ends up in all the scenarios.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I like the authenticity of the characters and the concepts of intrigue and great story lines. I hope there are more books planned for Garret Kohl.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Texas Sized Hero
reviews.reviewText: Garrett Kohl is good to have on your side when the wolf comes to the door. If you threaten those he loves or his Texas home there will be a reckoning. All of Taylor Moore's Garrett Kohl novels are a pleasure. I highly recommend this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: RICOCHET by Taylor MooreHankering for something different? This is it. A cowboy cocktail that will light your hair on fire: mix one part adrenaline-thrill ride, one part family in crisis, one part espionage, and a dash of uranium. Shake it. Stir it. Roll it down a hill. You’ve got yourself a RICOCHET.The third instalment in the Garrett Kohl saga takes things to the next level. Layered narratives that blend Kohl’s personal challenges—single/adopted father to Asadi, son to the cantankerous Butch, and lovelorn cowboy who just can’t seem to ask the woman of his dreams to marry him—with his seeming inability to not run to the sound of guns. It’s simply excellent.Here is the joy in Taylor’s writing. Not only is he a former practitioner who writes to his competencies, he does his research, and more to the point—he writes with heart. The Kohl family saga would be worth reading on its own. Add in the high-stakes adventure (and let’s face it, Garrett is a magnet for trouble) and you’ve got something you’re not going to be able to put down.Short version, buy a copy today and cancel your plans.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars If you have read the first two, you will definitely want this one
reviews.reviewText: Garrett Kohl is struggling to rebuild his ranch but his ranch and his family is again under attack by the threat against a nuclear research plant. This time he draws upon members of his community that have not always been on his side to fight back. If you lie Garrett Kohl, you will like this one, and you will look forward to a new book to see if new connections he has made will be in his best interest. I received this as an arc (though I had already pre-ordered it), and am under no pressure for a positive review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Incomplete book! Missing last chapter!
reviews.reviewText: Just got around to reading this great book. It ended (abruptly) on page 296. Was supposed to be 332. Since past return window Amazon would not replace.
